Package tools.io

Class FileTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.io.FileTools
  • public class FileTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Tool classes for all kinds of file operation.

      • readFile

        public static java.lang.String[] readFile​(java.io.File file)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a file and parses it into an array. The data in the file is split on new line character in the array.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to read from.
        Returns:
        An array representing the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there occured an exception during the IO operations.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile​(java.io.File file,
                             java.lang.String[] data,
                             boolean append)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Parses the data and writes it into a file. Each element in data is written on a separate line.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write to.
        data - The data to parse.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Iif there occured an exception during the IO operations.

      • getFileList

        public static java.util.List<PartFile> getFileList​(java.io.File root,
                                                   boolean listDirs)
        Lists all files in the given root directory.
        Furthermore, it holds for any entry that:
        • if it represents a file, then it is listed below it's parent directory.
        • if it represents a directory, then it is listed below the files in it's parent directory.
        • it is not listed below any directories which are on the same level as their parent directory and which are also listed below the parent directory entry.
        No other assumptions regarding file-order can be made on the output.
        Note that the directory entries are only listed if listDirs.
        Parameters:
        root - The root directory to start listing from.
        listDirs - Whether to list the directories.
        Returns:
        A list containing all files in the given root directory.

      • listFileTree

        public static java.io.InputStream listFileTree​(java.io.File root)
        Returns an InputStream which generates a tree structure from the given root directory.
        Parameters:
        root - The root directory.
        Returns:
        An InputStream which generates a tree structure from the given root directory.

        Parameters:

        options - The copy options for moving the files.
        Throws:

      • deleteAll

        public static boolean deleteAll​(java.io.File dir,
                                boolean deleteSelf)
        Deletes all files in the given directory, or deletes a single file if file is a file.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory to delete all files of.
        deleteSelf - Whether to delete the file itself. Only applies if the first argument denotes a directory.

      • forEachFile

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public static void forEachFile​(java.io.File root,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<java.io.File> action)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        The functionality already exists in FileTree.
        Executes an action for each file starting at the given root directory.
        If the root is a file, then it is accepted by default. If the root is a directory, then iterate over all files in that directory.

        If directories should be used in actions, they are always listed before any other files within that directory.
        Parameters:
        root - The root to start performing the actions.
        action - The action to perform.

      • forEachFile

        @Deprecated(forRemoval=true)
public static void forEachFile​(java.io.File root,
                               boolean listDirs,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<java.io.File> action)
        Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
        The functionality already exists in FileTree.
        Executes an action for each file starting at the given root directory.
        If the root is a file, then it is accepted by default. If the root is a directory, then iterate over all files in that directory.

        If directories should be used in actions, they are always listed before any other files within that directory.
        Parameters:
        root - The root to start performing the actions.
        listDirs - Whether to perform the action on directories.
        action - The action to perform.
